Description: Wheel-made oil-lamp with an open, mould-made body with a narrow, flat, overhanging rim and a slightly convex floor; short, rounded projecting nozzle (broken); ring base; hole in center; no handle. The underside is turned and slightly concave below. Black glazed. Soft orange Attic clay.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Black glaze lamp with good parallels from Athens in the British Museum (Bailey 1975, Q58 , Q57), dated late 5th to early 4th century BC, probably 425-400 BC.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (KC.37) (Phase 3)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.4836 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
